intro: Ligusticum nepalense, commonly known as Nepal lovage, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal, India, and Bhutan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils at high altitudes, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its rhizomes and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
